empty: Enter a JWT to see the decoded result.
error-invalidFormat: Invalid JWT format. A valid JWT must contain 3 parts: header.payload.signature.
error-invalidBase64: Invalid Base64URL encoding in the token. Some parts may be corrupted or incorrectly formatted.
error-unknownError: Unable to decode the JWT. Please make sure the token is valid and try again.

faq.q1: Is it safe to paste my JWT here?
faq.a1: Yes. This tool works 100% in your browser. Your JWT and secret key are never sent to any server.
faq.q2: Why can my JWT be read in plain text?
faq.a2: JWT payload is only Base64URL encoded, not encrypted. Anyone with the token can read the header and payload.
faq.a3: Only for HMAC algorithms (HS256, HS384, HS512). Public-key algorithms such as RS256 require a public key.
faq.a4: Common reasons include using the wrong secret key, different algorithm, or token tampering.
faq.q5: Does decoding a JWT mean authentication?
faq.a5: No. Decoding only reads the data. It does not verify identity or access permissions.
